{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question describes a 1-month-old child with conjugated bilirubinemia and intrahepatic cholestasis. The liver biopsy showed red colored granules inside the hepatocytes when stained with PAS. PAS-positive granules in hepatocytes are a characteristic feature of Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency as mentioned in Document [3] and Document [1]. Therefore, the probable diagnosis is Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency.", "answer_choice": "C"}
